title: Are there any elements of truth in racism and racist remarks? - Quora

response.answer_text: The only way I can answer that is from my personal experiences and years of observing people. Yes, racism exists in every society and yes, some elements of truth exist in a few stereotypes, however stretched or exaggerated beyond all reason. Whether intended to be hurtful and/or dismissive or as an attempt at humor, all of it is fairly a prime of human nature; the need to compare other people to your people. The funny thing, that NEVER seems funny to the person making a snide slur, is that the recipient is likely to’ve done the same about you at some point. ‘Them’ and ‘Us’ has been an integral part of our psyche since we first walked upright and noticed that group at the other end of what we thought was our personal savannah. H. Sapiens is a curious animal in that he seldom seems to learn from his mistakes. We also look at ourselves as above or below; better or worse than the next person or persons. Again, this is normal but unfortunate. Let’s see, Asians are supposed to be bad drivers or is that just Japanese drivers? Poles are said to be stupid, Mexicans and blacks are presumed lazy, Irish are only qualified to be cops or crooks, Scots and Jews are apparently cheap, Germans are Aryan supremacists and want to rule the world, All Italians are Mafia, the French are arrogant snobs, Indians smell like curry…Whites think they are superior to all the ‘darker’ races (but we still like to tan ourselves). God, how many more of these hateful and cruel stereotypes get bandied about day by day. The worst racial offense, to my way of thinking, is the ease with which some black people throw the word ‘Nigger’ at one other so casually but claim mortal insult if the word comes from outside their race. I find that word to be more offensive than any slander directed at my own ethnicity which is Scot/Norse. I also find it interesting that so many unique and distinct cultures are lumped together as White, Black, Hispanic or Asian. This is a bit off topic, or maybe not…a lot of Hispanics are happy to be called Latinos but Latin was invented by the Italians who are NOT considered to be Latin but White. Can anyone explain that contradiction?

Yes. If there weren’t, they wouldn’t have the impact and be believed as much as they are. But it’s only elements. A racist statement like “blacks are more likely to commit crime” is much more powerful and memorable if it relates to a specific incident of a black person committing a crime. Even more so if the crime is gruesome and notorious. The thing that makes it racist is taking that element of truth (a black person committed a crime) and distorting and expanding it in ways that cannot be logically justified (therefore most black people are likely to commit crimes). Without that seed of truth, it’s much harder to convince people to believe the falsehood. This is important to realize because if you try to argue against someone making racist remarks, they will often try to make the argument about the element of truth rather than the unjustifiable claims made based on it.

White American men are a bigger domestic terrorist threat than Muslim foreigners https://talynnkel.com/blog/2017/... I guess there is truth is all of these given that white people are the ones who disseminated these stats and articles about their own people.

I would say there are elements of truth in racial discussions and remarks, but in my book there’s no truth in racism and racist remarks are personally offensive to me, though I am not a person of color. Racism is mean and unnecessary. Racial discussions are essential to overcoming our problems with social justice.

No. Racism was invented to allow Colonial expansion to take over lands belonging to native occupants. By classifying the natives as inferiors, the Colonists were justified in stealing their land, and treating them as prisoners in their own homes. Today racism has no meaning. Its time has come and gone. Biological Aspects of Race

Sure, and when people of an ethnic group think they're alone, they tell all kinds of jokes about their own people! Irish folks tell stories about drunken Irishmen, Jews tell jokes about stereotypical Jewish relatives, and so on. But if outsiders tell those jokes, prepare for war!

I suspect you are referring to stereotypes. These things are created by our personal biases, and are usually supported by statistics based on faulty cause/effect analysis. Are rednecks a homogeneous group due to, environment, geography, upbringing, income level, education level, or, their color/race?
Nope. Racism is fundamentally irrational and untrue. A huge group of people - thousands, millions of people, cannot all have the same traits. Insisting they do is utterly irrational.

Yes, There are significant mental and physiological differences among the races. Africans have less body fat and more lean muscle due to the environment, while Caucasians have more body fat and less lean muscle, but have a higher average IQ and better social skills regardless of location.
Yes, they all emanate from prejudice and ignorance of the unity of the human race, which was confirmed by science in the 20th century.
